verses.text: And they continued three years without war between Syria and Israel.
And it came to pass in the third year , that Jehoshaphat the king of Judah came down to the king of Israel.

And the king of Israel said unto his servants , Know ye that Ramoth in Gilead \add is\add* ours, and we \add be\add* still , \add and\add* take it not out of the hand of the king of Syria ?\f + \fr 22.3 \ft still…: Heb. silent from taking it\f*

And he said unto Jehoshaphat , Wilt thou go with me to battle to Ramoth-gilead ? And Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel , I \add am\add* as thou \add art\add*, my people as thy people , my horses as thy horses.
And Jehoshaphat said unto the king of Israel , Enquire , I pray thee, at the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* to day.

Then the king of Israel gathered the prophets together , about four hundred men , and said unto them, Shall I go against Ramoth-gilead to battle , or shall I forbear ? And they said , Go up ; for the Lord shall deliver \add it\add* into the hand of the king.
And Jehoshaphat said , \add Is there\add* not here a prophet of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* besides , that we might enquire of him?

And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat , \add There is\add* yet one man , Micaiah the son of Imlah , by whom we may enquire of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: but I hate him; for he doth not prophesy good concerning me, but evil. And Jehoshaphat said , Let not the king say so.
Then the king of Israel called an officer , and said , Hasten \add hither\add* Micaiah the son of Imlah.\f + \fr 22.9 \ft officer: or, eunuch\f*

And the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah sat each on his throne , having put on their robes , in a void place in the entrance of the gate of Samaria ; and all the prophets prophesied before them.\f + \fr 22.10 \ft void…: Heb. floor\f*
And Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah made him horns of iron : and he said , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, With these shalt thou push the Syrians , until thou have consumed them.
And all the prophets prophesied so, saying , Go up to Ramoth-gilead , and prosper : for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall deliver \add it\add* into the king’s hand.

And the messenger that was gone to call Micaiah spake unto him, saying , Behold now, the words of the prophets \add declare\add* good unto the king with one mouth : let thy word , I pray thee, be like the word of one of them, and speak \add that which is\add* good.

And Micaiah said , \add As\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* liveth , what the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* saith unto me, that will I speak. \p

¶ So he came to the king. And the king said unto him, Micaiah , shall we go against Ramoth-gilead to battle , or shall we forbear ? And he answered him, Go , and prosper : for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall deliver \add it\add* into the hand of the king.
And the king said unto him, How many times shall I adjure thee that thou tell me nothing but \add that which is\add* true in the name of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*?

And he said , I saw all Israel scattered upon the hills , as sheep that have not a shepherd : and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said , These have no master : let them return every man to his house in peace.
And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat , Did I not tell thee that he would prophesy no good concerning me, but evil ?

And he said , Hear thou therefore the word of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: I saw the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* sitting on his throne , and all the host of heaven standing by him on his right hand and on his left.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said , Who shall persuade Ahab , that he may go up and fall at Ramoth-gilead ? And one said on this manner , and another said on that manner.\f + \fr 22.20 \ft persuade: or, deceive\f*
And there came forth a spirit , and stood before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and said , I will persuade him.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto him, Wherewith? And he said , I will go forth , and I will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets. And he said , Thou shalt persuade \add him\add*, and prevail also: go forth , and do so.

Now therefore, behold, the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath put a lying spirit in the mouth of all these thy prophets , and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath spoken evil concerning thee.
But Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah went near , and smote Micaiah on the cheek , and said , Which way went the Spirit of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* from me to speak unto thee?
And Micaiah said , Behold, thou shalt see in that day , when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.\f + \fr 22.25 \ft into…: or, from chamber to chamber: Heb. a chamber in a chamber\f*
And the king of Israel said , Take Micaiah , and carry him back unto Amon the governor of the city , and to Joash the king’s son ;
And say , Thus saith the king , Put this \add fellow\add* in the prison , and feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction , until I come in peace.
And Micaiah said , If thou return at all in peace , the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath not spoken by me. And he said , Hearken , O people , every one of you. \p
So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramoth-gilead.

And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat , I will disguise myself, and enter into the battle ; but put thou on thy robes. And the king of Israel disguised himself, and went into the battle.\f + \fr 22.30 \ft I will…: or, when he was to disguise himself, and enter into the battle\f*
But the king of Syria commanded his thirty and two captains that had rule over his chariots , saying , Fight neither with small nor great , save only with the king of Israel.

And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat , that they said , Surely it \add is\add* the king of Israel. And they turned aside to fight against him: and Jehoshaphat cried out.
And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots perceived that it \add was\add* not the king of Israel , that they turned back from pursuing him.

And a \add certain\add* man drew a bow at a venture , and smote the king of Israel between the joints of the harness : wherefore he said unto the driver of his chariot , Turn thine hand , and carry me out of the host ; for I am wounded.\f + \fr 22.34 \ft at a…: Heb. in his simplicity\f*\f + \fr 22.34 \ft joints…: Heb. joints and the breastplate\f*\f + \fr 22.34 \ft wounded: Heb. made sick\f*

And the battle increased that day : and the king was stayed up in his chariot against the Syrians , and died at even : and the blood ran out of the wound into the midst of the chariot.\f + \fr 22.35 \ft increased: Heb. ascended\f*\f + \fr 22.35 \ft midst: Heb. bosom\f*
And there went a proclamation throughout the host about the going down of the sun , saying , Every man to his city , and every man to his own country. \p
¶ So the king died , and was brought to Samaria ; and they buried the king in Samaria.\f + \fr 22.37 \ft was brought: Heb. came\f*

And \add one\add* washed the chariot in the pool of Samaria ; and the dogs licked up his blood ; and they washed his armour ; according unto the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* which he spake.

Now the rest of the acts of Ahab , and all that he did , and the ivory house which he made , and all the cities that he built , \add are\add* they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel ?
So Ahab slept with his fathers ; and Ahaziah his son reigned in his stead. \p
¶ And Jehoshaphat the son of Asa began to reign over Judah in the fourth year of Ahab king of Israel.
Jehoshaphat \add was\add* thirty and five years old when he began to reign ; and he reigned twenty and five years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name \add was\add* Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.

And he walked in all the ways of Asa his father ; he turned not aside from it, doing \add that which was\add* right in the eyes of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: nevertheless the high places were not taken away ; \add for\add* the people offered and burnt incense yet in the high places.
And Jehoshaphat made peace with the king of Israel.
Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat , and his might that he shewed , and how he warred , \add are\add* they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah ?
And the remnant of the sodomites , which remained in the days of his father Asa , he took out of the land.
\add There was\add* then no king in Edom : a deputy \add was\add* king.
Jehoshaphat made ships of Tharshish to go to Ophir for gold : but they went not; for the ships were broken at Ezion-geber.\f + \fr 22.48 \ft made…: or, had ten ships\f*
Then said Ahaziah the son of Ahab unto Jehoshaphat , Let my servants go with thy servants in the ships. But Jehoshaphat would not. \p
¶ And Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers , and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father : and Jehoram his son reigned in his stead. \p
¶ Ahaziah the son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria the seventeenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah , and reigned two years over Israel.

And he did evil in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and walked in the way of his father , and in the way of his mother , and in the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat , who made Israel to sin :
For he served Baal , and worshipped him, and provoked to anger the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel , according to all that his father had done.
